member.name: M:GrapeCity.Common.GcNetFxLicenseProvider`1.VerifyDesignTimeEnvironment
member.summary: Verify the environment to get whether the component is in design-time.
member.returns: true if it is in design-time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: In DesignTime, because of IDE bugs, some component are not created with DesigntimeLicenseContext. For example, when drag a control from Win Forms DataSource tool window, or use a web control in a ASP.NET Template. This may cause the control do run-time license validation and found that there is no license. To resolve this problem, we will check the environment and decide whether to do design-time license validation again.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3DBase.baseChart.UseGrayscale
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the chart with grayscale instead of color.
The use of Grayscale is intended as a preview for output to a black and white device. It does not affect style brush or pen colors internally, only the rendering of the chart to the output device. Using grayscale implies the use of double buffered output.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use anti-aliasing when displaying the chart. This property is now obsolete. Instead, use UseAntiAliasedText and UseAntiAliasedGraphics to manage text and graphics antialiasing independently.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use anti-aliasing while rendering chart text (only).

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use anti-aliasing while rendering chart graphics (only).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.C1Chart3D.UseGrayscale
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the chart with grayscale instead of color.
The use of Grayscale is intended as a preview for output to a black and white device. It does not affect style brush or pen colors internally, only the rendering of the chart to the output devices and images. Using grayscale implies the use of double buffered output.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.C1Chart3D.Repaint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart is automatically repainted when its properties are modified.

remarks.para: When the Repaint property is false, chart repaints are minimized as chart properties are changed. This is useful when multiple chart properties will be changed in an event, and it is desired to reduce the flicker associated with repeated repaints.
Note that it is very important to set Repaint to true when property changes have been completed. Failure to do so can result in a chart that never repaints.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.C1Chart3D.AssemblyFileVersionString
member.summary: Gets the controls AssemblyFileVersion as a string. The AssemblyFileVersion is also viewable from the properties dialog of the control assembly dll.

remarks.para: The AssemblyFileVersion is different from the AssemblyVersion. The AssemblyFileVersion is viewable from the properties dialog of the control assembly dll. The AssemblyVersion is also listed in the properties dialog, but only in the other version information section. When viewing the Global Assembly Cache (GAC) in Windows Explorer, the AssemblyVersion is shown as a standard column.
The AssemblyFileVersion will always change with each separate release of the Chart control, including internal changes. The AssemblyVersion will only change when the object model has been changed.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.AnnoFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format.

remarks.para: The AnnoFormat property allow specification of numeric and time formats using enumerated values.

For numeric values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net class, including Currency, General, Exponential, Percentage, Roundtrip and Hexadecimal. NumericManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

For date/time values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net class, including combinations of long and short dates and times, and universal time representations. DateManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DAxis.AnnoFormatString
member.summary: Gets or set the annotation format string used with manual formats.

remarks.para: Only used when AnnoFormat property is NumericManual or DateManual. The AnnoFormatString property specifies a custom string for formatting the annotations along the axis.

When the AnnoFormat property is NumericManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format strings as described by the .Net double.ToString(AnnoFormatString) method call. Custom numeric format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under Custom Numeric Format Strings. If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then g or General is used.

When the AnnoFormat property is DateManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format string as described by the .Net DateTime.ToString(AnnoFormatSTring) method call. Custom DateTime format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under Date and Time Format Strings. If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then C1Chart selects a format string appropriate for the time span defined by the axis maximum and minimum values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DData.LoadDataFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Load the contents of the current Chart3DData object from the specified file.
member.remarks: This method loads the current Chart3DData object with the contents of the specified file. The data format is defined by file extension. If file extension is dat then ComponentOne Chart 7 data format is used for loading data. Using any other extension leads to reading data in xml format. If an error occurs during the file reading, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DData.LoadDataFromFile(System.String,C1.Win.C1Chart3D.DataFormatEnum)
member.summary: Load the contents of the current Chart3DData object from the specified file using specified format.
member.remarks: This method loads the current Chart3DData object with the contents to the specified file in specified data format. If an error occurs during the file reading, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DData.SaveDataToFile(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the current Chart3DData object to the specified file in XML or ComponentOne Chart 7 format (.dat).
member.remarks: This method saves the Chart3DData object contents to the specified file. The data format is defined by file extension. If file extension is dat then ComponentOne Chart 7 data format is used. Using any other extension leads to saving data in xml format. If an error occurs during the file creation or writing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DData.SaveDataToFile(System.String,C1.Win.C1Chart3D.DataFormatEnum)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the current Chart3DData object to the specified file in XML or ComponentOne Chart 7 format (.dat).
member.remarks: This method saves the Chart3DData object contents to the specified file in specified data format. If an error occurs during the file creation or writing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.summary: Transparency of drawing chart data.
member.remarks: 0 transparent, 255 opaque. Applied only for non-contoured and non-zoned chart.

member.summary: The bottom color of the mesh.
member.remarks: For bar charts, this color is used for bars with a value less than that specified by the Chart3DBar Origin property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom color of the shaded surface.

member.summary: The bottom color of the shaded surface.
member.remarks: For bar charts, this color is used for bars with a value less than that specified by the Chart3DBar Origin property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DElevation.IsMeshed
member.summary: Determines whether surface charts are meshed, or whether bars in bar charts are outlined. Set this property to true to display a surface as a mesh, or to display bars in outline format.
member.remarks: Only for bar and surface charts. The IsColumnMeshShowing and IsRowMeshShowing properties of the Chart3DSurface object control allow mesh lines in either the X or the Y direction to be turned off.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DElevation.IsShaded
member.summary: Determines whether surface or bar charts use shading. Set this property to true to display surfaces and bars as a flat shade of color.
member.remarks: Only for bar and surface charts.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Interaction
member.summary: Contains all properties that control the automated interactive features of the chart, including mouse driven rotation, scaling, translating and zooming.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Interaction.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart interaction is enabled.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Interaction.Actions
member.summary: Gets the collection of available interactive actions.

remarks.para:
The following actions are available:
Rotate - rotate chart,
Scale - change scale of chart,
Translate - scroll through chart,
Zoom - select rectangular area of chart for view.
Reset - reset chart to default view.
SetFreeRotation - set free rotation mode(default).
SetRotationAxisX - set rotation around x-axis.
SetRotationAxisY - set rotation around y-axis.
SetRotationAxisZ - set rotation around z-axis.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.LegendOrientationEnum.Auto
member.summary: Horizontal for legends with north and south Compass values, and Vertical for legends with east and west Compass values.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.LegendOrientationEnum.Vertical
member.summary: Legend entries are stacked vertically as legend height permits. If sufficient height is not available, additional legend columns are created.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.LegendOrientationEnum.Horizontal
member.summary: Legend entries are added side by side as (horizontally) as legend width permits. If sufficient width is not available, additional legend rows are created.

member.summary: Gets the index of the legend series entry closest to the specified coordinates.
member.returns: This method returns true when a legend series entry exists at the specified coordinate. The seriesIndex is set as it is passed by reference.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DLegend.RectFromSeries(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the minimal Rectangle that circumscribes the specified series entry in the legend.
member.returns: Rectangle.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DLegend.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the legend entries.

remarks.para: The legend entries can be oriented in a vertical or horizontal fashion.

Vertical orientation indicates that legend entries will stack vertically as the legend height permits. If the legend height cannot contain all of the entries and the legend is allowed to size itself, then additional columns of stacked entries will be added to the legend.

Horizontal orientation indicates that legend entries will be created side by side as legend width permits. If the legend width cannot contain all of the entries and the legend is allowed to size itself, then additional rows of entries will be added to the legend.

Auto orientation automatically selects an appropriate orientation based upon the legend Compass property. For east and west Compass values, Vertical orientation is used. For north and south Compass values, Horizontal orientation is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DLegend.Compass
member.summary: Gets or sets the general positioning of the legend.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView
member.summary: The Chart3DView defines the three-dimensional features of a chart. It is returned by the View property of a Chart3DArea.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView.ResetTransformation
member.summary: Resets all transformation parameters to their default values.
member.remarks: The transformation parameters that are reset include Xscale, Yscale, RotationX, RotationY, RotationZ, Perspective, ViewportScale, ViewPortHorizontalShift, and ViewportVerticalShift.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView.ViewportHorizontalShift
member.summary: Gets or sets horizontal shift of chart viewport.
member.remarks: Specifies the degree of horizontal view translation from a full view (a maximal, non-clipped view). Translation is relative to a normalized box with origin in the bottom left corner. Translation of more than a full unit (more than 1.0 or -1.0) causes the view to translate out of view when ViewPortScale=1. This property is updated if the user dynamically translates the view.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView.ViewportVerticalShift
member.summary: Gets or sets vertical shift of chart viewport.
member.remarks: Specifies the degree of vertical view translation from a full view. Translation is relative to a normalized box with origin in the bottom left corner. Translation of more than a full unit (more than 1.0 or -1.0) causes the view to translate out of view when ViewPortScale=1. This property is updated if the user dynamically translates the view.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView.ViewportScale
member.summary: Gets or sets scale of chart viewport.
member.remarks: Specifies the degree of scaling (zooming) up or down from a full (maximal, non-clipped) view. This property is updated if the user dynamically scales or zooms the view.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Chart3DView.Perspective
member.summary: Perspective of 3-D view.
member.remarks: Must be a value greater than 1. Higher values reduce the perspective effect and approach a parallel projection.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Style.Autowrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text is automatically wrapped.
member.remarks: Most text containing objects within C1Chart3D can automatically wrap text within them, including header, footer, axes titles, labels and the legend (title only, not series names). However, all of these objects can be sized automatically. Automatic sizing is always based upon a single line of text whenever possible.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Style.VerticalText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text is displayed vertically.
member.remarks: VerticalText allows some double byte characters to be rendered from top to bottom instead of left to right. For single byte characters VerticalText appears as rotated text, 90 degrees in the clockwise direction.

member.summary: The Title class is used to describe the appearance of the Header and the Footer.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.Compass
member.summary: Gets or sets the general positioning of the title.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the title in chart control client coordinates.
member.remarks: The Location property always returns the actual location of the upper, left corner of the chart element it describes whether or not the element placement is manual or automatic. Modifying this value will change LocationDefault.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the title in chart control client coordinates.
member.remarks: The Size property always returns the actual size of the chart element it describes whether or not the element placement is manual or automatic. Modifying this value will change SizeDefault.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.LocationDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the default location of the title.
member.remarks: The LocationDefault property specifies the location of the upper, left corner of the chart element it describes. Non-negative values indicate the explicit position in chart client coordinates to place the chart element. Negative values will allow auto-positioning.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.ShouldSerializeLocationDefault
member.summary: Returns false if the Title LocationDefault property is in the default state.
member.returns: Boolean value.
member.remarks: The default state is LocationDefault.Width = -1, LocationDefault.Height = -1, which results in automatic location of the Title based upon the Compass property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.SizeDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the title.
member.remarks: The SizeDefault property specifies the size of the chart element it describes. Non-negative values indicate the explicit width and height in chart client coordinates to place the chart element. Negative values will allow auto-positioning.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart3D.Title.ShouldSerializeSizeDefault
member.summary: Returns false if the Title SizeDefault property is in the default state.
member.returns: Boolean value.
member.remarks: The default state is SizeDefault.Width = -1, SizeDefault.Height = -1, which results in automatic sizing of the Title.

member.summary: Summary description for C1Chart3DDesigner.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.
So the solution is this:

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ShowAboutBox(System.Object)
member.summary: Shows the About Box for an instance of a C1 product.

member.summary: Get the type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'.
member.param: Instance of an object whose type is to be checked.
member.returns: The type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'
